result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Serjio Garcia

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 24, 2023 at 09:30 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF207, 22CF209, 22CF208, 21CF360, 22CF195, 22CF205, 22CF206 called at 3:25 PM 
Defendant Dionicio Chavez Leon in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for Dionicio Chavez Leon.  
Defendant Martha Chavez in court. Attorney Daniel Olsen in court for Martha Chavez. 
Defendant Sergio Garcia in court. Attorney Jason Gonzalez in court for Sergio Garcia. 
Attorney Krysta Parson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Liesl Monroy remains under oath as Spanish Interpreter.

Atty Huebner indicates he is ready to proceed to trial. 

Atty Gonzalez indicates that Mr. Garcia wishes to resolve all of his cases short of trial, requests trial not occur next week to allow negotiations; additionally that has a Rock Co case also proceeding to trial on same date. 

ADA Parson indicates that drug test results have not yet been returned from lab; additionally that speedy trial request pends in Ms. Chavez's case. 

Atty Olsen does not object to the State's continuance request. Atty Olsen will toll speedy request until next hearing; additionally that will be filing a request for an interpreter be 'appointed' to Ms. Chavez's case. 

The Court grants Atty Olsen's oral motion for interpreter services to be provided for Ms. Chavez during meetings with Atty Olsen. Atty Olsen is to notify COC when/where meetings will occur to allow interpreter to be scheduled. 

Atty Huebner has no objection to any of the requests made by other Parties.

The Court finds it appropriate to move Tuesday and Wednesdays trial. 

recess: 3:40pm 
NEXT: As to Cases, 22CF206, 22CF208, 22CF207(1)FSSC 1/24/23 at 9:30am  (2)Jury Trial on 1/30/23 & 1/31/23 at 8:30am 
All Other Cases to be set for Status on 1/24/22 at 9:30am
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Status conference on September 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[ml] Cases 21CF360, 22CF195, and 22CF205 called at 9:13AM
Defendant Serjio Garcia in court with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court first addresses the Waiver of Preliminary Hearing in file 22CF195:
The Defendant waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

-----------------------------------------------

The Court then turns to the contested Preliminary Hearing in file 22CF205:

Detective Benjamin Miller - sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Witt
--cross examination by Attorney Gonzalez

The Court finds probable cause that the Defendant committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment in files 22CF195 and 22CF205:
--service of Informations admitted, readings waived
--pleas of "not guilty" entered as to all Counts in both files
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trials.

Att Gonzalez raises inquiries regarding a separate case [22CF206] scheduling conflict and the impact with the co-defendant cases. Att Gonzalez indicates that he will attempt to resolve the conflict.

recess 9:38AM

NEXT:  
(1) Pretrial Conference on  09/14 at 11:00AM with counsel appearances only
(2) Status Conference on 09/19 at 3:30PM with in person appearances (tracks along with existing scheduling in file 22CF206)
Waiver of Prelim on August 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cases 21CF3660, 22CF195 and 22CF205 called at 10:02am
Prosecuting attorney Krysta Parson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Serjio Garcia in court.  Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez in court for Serjio Garcia. 

On the Court's own motion because of calendar congestion and with the agreement of the parties, the Court continues the cases to 8/19/22 at 9am.  
22CF205 - PH, 22CF195 - WOPH (state form filed today over the bench) and 21CF360 - STC. 
Recess 10:03am. 

NEXT - (Notices to be mailed.)
8/18/22 at 9am - 22CF205 - PH, 22CF195 - WOPH (state form filed today over the bench) and 21CF360 - STC.
Status conference on July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
ec: DA and Atty Gonzalez (6/20/20--ma)
for Continuance
for Continuance
Preliminary hearing on July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Cases 21CF360, 22CF195, 22CF205, 22CF206 10:53 AM 
Defendant Serjio Garcia in court with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Gonzalez requests new cases be scheduled for preliminary hearing, and trial be adjourned; but defers to the Court. 
--ADA Beck indicates State is prepared to proceed to trial, but does not object to Atty Gonzalez's request. 

The Court removes trial scheduled for Monday in Case 21CF360
recess: 11:01am 
NEXT: As to Cases 22CF195, 22CF205, 22CF206, Preliminary Hearing on 7/29/22 at 8:30am [please note this in co-defendant's files(22CF206)]
As to Case 21CF360, Status on 7/29/22 at 8:30am

[ml] Case 22CF195, 22CF205, and 22CF206 called at 1:15 PM
Defendant Serjio Garcia appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with attorney Jeffery De La Rosa. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.
These files were not scheduled for an appearance today, however the Court called these files at the request of Att De La Rosa.
Att De La Rosa advises that there was some confusion as the whether or not the Defendant was to appear today. The State advises that the Defendant is not scheduled to appear today, and is being held the bench warrants in the above cases.
Att De La Rosa advises that he will call Att Jason Gonzalez and see if he can appear to help clear the warrants.
The Court agrees with this, and sets this matter over for another hearing this afternoon so that Att Gonzalez may appear, if he is able to, so that the warrants be cleared.

recess 1:21PM

---------------------------------------------

reconvene 1:52PM

Defendant Seijo Garcia appears by videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody. Attorney Jason Gonzalez appears via telephone. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Att Gonzalez advises that the Defendant missed his last court appearance due to an error on the Defendant's part.
Bond arguments are given.

The Court reinstates all bonds in each file and admonishes the Defendant for missing court.

recess 1:58PM

[Post Hearing, Off the Record: The Court directs the Clerk to remove the 07/25/22 BBH from its calendar]

NEXT: Status Conference on 06/13 at 10:45AM (to track along with scheduling in file 21CF360)

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Gonzalez

Adjustment Number: 22A 117778,
Payable Number: 192257,
Amount: $20.00
Extradition Forecast

[ml] Cases 22CF195, 22CF205, and 22CF206 called at 8:52AM
Court Reporter Kathy Redlin.
Defendant Serjio Garcia DOES NOT appear. Attorney Jason Gonzalez does not appear. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court notes the Defense non-appearance and affirms today's hearing has been sufficiently noticed.

The State requests that a Bench Warrant be issued.
The Court orders a Bench Warrant, Body Only in each above file, returnable to any Jefferson County Judge or Magistrate.
The Court finds the posted or signed bonds in the above files to be in default.

recess 8:54AM
Scheduling Order

Pre-trial conference on May 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ml] Cases 22CF195, 22CF205, and 22CF206 called at 1:38PM
Defendant Serjio Garcia in court, without counsel. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant advises that he hired Att Jason Gonzalez for these files, however Att Gonzalez does not appear.
The Court goes off the record so that the JA may contact Att Gonzalez.

recess 1:40PM

-------------------------------------------

reconvene 1:43PM

Attorney Jason Gonzalez now appears by telephone. All other appearances remain the same.

Att Gonzalez advises that he will be the Defendant's attorney of record for all the files listed above.
Parties waive Preliminary Hearing time limits.

recess 1:50PM

NEXT: 
In all files:
(1) Pretrial Conference on 05/18 at 9:30AM with counsel appearances 
(2) Preliminary Hearing on 05/27 at 8:30AM with in person appearances
Event entered in error
Adjourned initial appearance on May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Conditions of this Bond include:
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid license and an IID

[ml] Case called at 1:57PM
Defendant Serjio Garcia appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (PD appears for bond-purposes only; Def waived eval).  ADA Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient by counsel agreement. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court preserves the Defendant's jurisdicitional objections and tolls Prelimianry Hearing time limits. The Court sets this matter over for Status of Counsel.

The Court requires a $1,500.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid license and an IID

recess 2:03PM

NEXT:
Status Confenrece (also Status of Cousnel and Adjurned Inital Appearance) on 05/12 at 1:30PM
